Bryant was hired to do a play-by-play for a few games for the NFL, but during his show last week, Real Sports on HBO, as he does very - every show.
I shouldn't say very often, but every show at the end of it…
Right.
…he gives a commentary, usually a very stinging commentary.

And this time, many people say he bit the hand that is feeding him in talking about the outgoing Commissioner, Paul Tagliabue, and his relationship with Gene Upshaw, a former NFL player and now head of the Players Union.
He told Tagliabue to tell the new commissioner coming in, where he held Gene Upshaw's leash, and that this head of the Players Union was docile, and his personal pet.
